item.title: SNAP benefits must be fully paid by Trump administration by Friday, judge orders
item.description: The Trump administration recently said it would not pay any SNAP benefits, but then offered partial funding of the food stamp program after a judge's ...

item.title: DC sandwich thrower Sean Dunn found not guilty of assaulting federal agent
item.description: Former DOJ employee Sean Dunn was charged with tossing a Subway sandwich at a federal officer who had been deployed to Washington by President Trump.

item.title: Judge dismisses Boeing criminal case over 737 Max crashes at DOJ request despite skepticism
item.description: Judge Reed O'Connor said a DOJ nonprosecution agreement with Boeing "fails to secure the necessary accountability to ensure the safety of the flying p...

item.title: Nancy Pelosi announces retirement from Congress
item.description: Pelosi, who represented California for decades, made history as the first female speaker of the House of Representatives.

item.title: Supreme Court justices appear skeptical that Trump tariffs are legal
item.description: President Donald Trump calls the Supreme Court case on his tariffs a matter of "life or death" for the United States.
